get.description:
Returns Patient based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Patient.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Patient.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select Patients based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Use two _lastUpdated parameters to provide a range. The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select Patients based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the Patient. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the patient. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the Patient. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of Patients that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: Used to request the server to return a subset of the resource. It can contain one of the following values: true, false, text, data or count.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Used to search the entire content of the Patient resource.

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Used to search on the narrative of the Patient resource.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular Patient, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes i.e. Patient  2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular Patient, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes i.e. Patient 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Whether the patient record is active.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: An address in any kind of address/part of the patient.

parameters.name: address-city
parameters.description: A city specified in an address

parameters.name: address-country
parameters.description: A country specified in an address

parameters.name: address-postalcode
parameters.description: A postalCode specified in an address

parameters.name: address-state
parameters.description: A state specified in an address

parameters.name: address-use
parameters.description: A use code specified in an address.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: animal-breed
parameters.description: The breed for animal patients. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: animal-species
parameters.description: The species for animal patients. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: The patient's date of birth. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: The patient's date of birth. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: careprovider
parameters.description: Patient's nominated care provider, could be a care manager, not the organization that manages the record.

parameters.name: deathdate
parameters.description: The date of death has been provided and satisfies this search value. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: deathdate
parameters.description: The date of death has been provided and satisfies this search value. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <=,  < and != may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: deceased
parameters.description: This patient has been marked as deceased, or as a death date entered. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A value in an email contact. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: A portion of the family name of the patient

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Gender of the patient. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: given
parameters.description: A portion of the given name of the patient

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A patient identifier. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language code (irrespective of use value). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: All patients linked to the given patient

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A portion of either family or given name of the patient

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The organization at which this person is a patient.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: A value in a phone contact. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: phonetic
parameters.description: A portion of either family or given name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

parameters.name: telecom
parameters.description: The value in any kind of telecom details of the patient.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: stateid
parameters.description: Unique id associated with a page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Patient resource offset.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of Patient resources requested in a page.

parameters.name: _pretty
parameters.description: Set true to get prettified data.

parameters.name: _bundletype
parameters.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle. Values can be one of: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of resources based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.

parameters.description: A use code specified in an address.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: animal-breed
parameters.description: The breed for animal patients. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: animal-species
parameters.description: The species for animal patients. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: The patient's date of birth. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: The patient's date of birth. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: careprovider
parameters.description: Patient's nominated care provider, could be a care manager, not the organization that manages the record.

parameters.name: deathdate
parameters.description: The date of death has been provided and satisfies this search value. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: deathdate
parameters.description: The date of death has been provided and satisfies this search value. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <=,  < and != may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: deceased
parameters.description: This patient has been marked as deceased, or as a death date entered. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A value in an email contact. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: A portion of the family name of the patient

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Gender of the patient. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: given
parameters.description: A portion of the given name of the patient

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A patient identifier. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language code (irrespective of use value). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: All patients linked to the given patient

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A portion of either family or given name of the patient

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The organization at which this person is a patient.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: A value in a phone contact. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: phonetic
parameters.description: A portion of either family or given name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

parameters.name: telecom
parameters.description: The value in any kind of telecom details of the patient.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].
